ProjectTitle: Integrated computer modelling of cardiorespiratory fitness for personalised risk profiling and heart failure prevention (iCAREFIT)
InitialFeedbackHistory: 12/05/2022 2. [REDACTED] under metadata you write "not applicable" but according to your data table you do collect metadata; you mention DICOM files for echocardiography, these use the DICOM metadata standard and redcap also generates metadata that you can mention here. [REDACTED] proteomics you may use MIAPE https://www.psidev.info/miape. 5. Please note that, if your study falls under the clinical trail regulation, the CTC expects related data to be preserved for 25 years.(https://gbiomed.kuleuven.be/english/ctc) 6. [REDACTED] do you make the data findable for peers? [REDACTED] can consider using a repository, for example KU [REDACTED] RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr) or PRIDE (www.ebi.ac.uk/pride/). [REDACTED] can restrict access to sensitive datasets and others can request access via the repository.
label: good with suggestions
